borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">The proposed extensions, by reason of their&nbsp;excessive scale, presents an excessive and bulky feature in relation to the size of the original dwellinghouse, and unbalances the property and results in the loss of symmetry along a terrace row of houses which is unsympathetic to the design of the original dwellinghouse and surrounding dwellinghouses.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; text-align: justify;">This is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy D4 of the London Plan&nbsp;(March 2021);&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; description: Construction of a first floor side and rear extension
